derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French fidelite or Latin fidelitas, from fidelis 'faithful', from fides 'faith'. Compare with fealty

entry.tran: (对人、组织或信仰的)忠诚，忠实
entry.def: Fidelity is loyalty to a person, organization, or set of beliefs.

example.ex: I had to promise fidelity to the Queen.

entry.def: Fidelity is being loyal to your husband, wife, or partner by not having a sexual relationship with anyone else.

example.ex: Wanting fidelity implies you're thinking about a major relationship.
example.tran: 要求忠诚意味着你想发展一段严肃认真的恋爱关系。

entry.tran: (报告或翻译的)准确度，精确度，确切度
entry.def: The fidelity of something such as a report or translation is the degree to which it is accurate.

example.tran: 这些早期文件的准确性

means.word_mean: 1. accuracy with which an electronic system reproduces the sound or image of its input signal

stems_affixes.word_buile: confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ent……的→adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 秘[机]密的;表示信任的;担任机密工作的
stems_affixes.word_buile: confident[adj.[of,in]确信的,自信的]+ial……的→相信的人才知道
dif不+fid相信+ent……的→不相信[自己]→自卑的
fid信任,相信,信念+uciary……的→相信的→信托的
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
af一再+fid信任,相信,信念+avit表名词→一再发誓相信→宣誓书
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ant人→confidant可以吐露真情的人
confide[v.吐露[心事],委托,信赖]+ence表名词→n.[in]信任;信心,自信;秘密,机密
fid信任,相信,信念+elity表示性质→相信的性质
in不+fid信任,相信,信念+el→不信宗教的人
per假+fid相信+y状态→假相信→不忠诚
